title: Porazdir

properties.name: description
properties.value: Porazdir is a Tsutsaroth demon[1] who was once one of Zamorak's most trusted generals during the God Wars. Said to kill any in his path without mercy, even if they are demons, Porazdir is described as "completely mad", and regularly clashes with Justiciar Zachariah.[2]

Porazdir is a Tsutsaroth demon[1] who was once one of Zamorak's most trusted generals during the God Wars. Said to kill any in his path without mercy, even if they are demons, Porazdir is described as "completely mad", and regularly clashes with Justiciar Zachariah.[2]

During Mage Arena II miniquest, he has to be defeated in order to obtain a demon's heart for Kolodion's spell during Mage Arena II miniquest. In order to summon it, players must use an enchanted symbol to locate it, similar to using an enchanted key or strange device.

When fighting Porazdir, it can use a special attack that will fire a ball of energy at the player that can hit through protection prayers for upwards of 30 damage. When it uses this attack a message in the chatbox will state Porazdir fires a ball of energy directly linked to his power! This damage cannot be negated, but if players are very far from him (12 tiles) when the ball hits them, no damage will be taken.

A player fighting Porazdir.

Porazdir can only be harmed by the Flames of Zamorak spell. As such, a Zamorak staff, staff of the dead or its toxic counterpart is required to defeat it. Porazdir is considered a black demon for the purpose of a Slayer assignment.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
17 March 2021
(update)

Several monsters, including Porazdir, were tagged as demonic, allowing demonbane weapons to work on them.

8 February 2018
(update)

The monster was added to the game.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ghost's Twitter account. 29 January 2018. (Archived from the original on 28 May 2020.) Mod Ghost: "It's a Tsutsaroth."
  2. ↑ "Kolodion", Old School RuneScape. "From what I can tell, he is completely mad. He roams the Wilderness, killing all who he comes across without mercy. Even his own kind do not escape his fury. He's known to battle the justiciar quite regularly, perhaps they are old enemies."

'''Porazdir''' is a Tsutsaroth [[demon]]{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ghost|url=https://twitter.com/Jagex_Ghost/status/958026744002498561|date=29 January 2018|archiveurl=https://archive.is/sSABh|archivedate=28 May 2020|quote=It's a Tsutsaroth.}} who was once one of [[Zamorak]]'s most trusted generals during the [[God Wars]]. Said to kill any in his path without mercy, even if they are demons, Porazdir is described as "completely mad", and regularly clashes with [[Justiciar Zachariah]].{{CiteNPC|loc=Kolodion|quote=From what I can tell, he is completely mad. He roams the Wilderness, killing all who he comes across without mercy. Even his own kind do not escape his fury. He's known to battle the justiciar quite regularly, perhaps they are old enemies.}}

During [[Mage Arena II]] [[miniquest]], he has to be defeated in order to obtain a [[demon's heart]] for [[Kolodion]]'s spell during [[Mage Arena II]] [[Miniquests|miniquest]]. In order to summon it, players must use an [[enchanted symbol]] to locate it, similar to using an [[Enchanted key (item)|enchanted key]] or [[strange device]].

When fighting Porazdir, it can use a special attack that will fire a ball of energy at the player that can hit through [[protection prayers]] for upwards of 30 [[damage]]. When it uses this attack a message in the [[chatbox]] will state {{Colour|#ef1020|Porazdir fires a ball of energy directly linked to his power!}} This damage cannot be negated, but if players are very far from him (12 tiles) when the ball hits them, no damage will be taken.[[File:Fighting Porazdir.png|thumb|270px|left|A player fighting Porazdir.]]

Porazdir can only be harmed by the [[Flames of Zamorak]] spell. As such, a [[Zamorak staff]], [[staff of the dead]] or its [[Toxic staff of the dead|toxic counterpart]] is required to defeat it. Porazdir is considered a [[black demon]] for the purpose of a Slayer assignment.
